column5: This is one of the first videos I did...  lol.. had the vcr running off a battery in the rain...  we've come along way since then.. We caught pickerel after pickerel on this lake, just trolling for pike.. it was a blast.
Not me boss.. many have come that way, although the last one I caught came on a 7" white Muskie Tube fishing for Lakers!!
LOL.... I never catch them when I want too.
love them vids your posting man keep up the good footage!

HEY TJ  I caught my first PIC on a spoon last year casting for pike...  But what surprised me the most fishing for bass is catching PICS with 3/4oz spinnerbaits,  I caught 3 in one day on Sturgeon, very cool  Dave

most pickerel I have caught have come on spoons (not that I'm targetting them that way...just incidentals when pike fishing). trusty 5 of diamonds...pickerel love em. Now bass I have never caught on a spoon.
spinnerbaits worked well on the thames and lake fanshawe for pickeral too
Gold coloured Johnson SilverMinnows work wonders for shallow weed WALLEYE.
when it comes to pickeral i can tell you EVERY lure that they will not bite.....     it would be EVERY lure i use !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! damn fish !!!!!!!!!!!
We used to catch eyes on Nippising with red and whites.
I have caught plenty of walleye on spoons.....so I didnt say it.

WOW!  Now thats a fishing video!  I caught some on those bad/nasty boyz (whatever they're called) whilst fishing rainbows out of Erieau a couple summers ago....black and purple ones i seem to remember.   TJ....i gotta ask...whats your camera set up?
Yep me too.... good old red devil..... go figure Nice footage TJ Thanks for sharing Leechman

a couple of years ago up on Nipissing during our "Crayola Cup" I had a nice 2 pound (or so) pickerel follow a five of diamonds back to the boat. I cast it out again and the pickerel came back, this time with about a 50 inch musky following him! gotta love Nipissing (except I didn't catch either fish...dang Nipissing)
